title: Way-too-early Grand Slam predictions for the rest of 2025
description: Madison Keys won her first Grand Slam and Jannik Sinner defended his Australian Open title. What does this mean for the rest of the year? We take a look.
author: D'Arcy Maine

title: 'He's in a different universe right now': Jannik Sinner's dominance on display at Australian Open
description: Sinner won his second Australian Open title, cementing his place as the best in the world. Will he get only better from here?
author: Jake Michaels

title: Unlock the Perfect Slice Serve - Essential Tennis Podcast #415
description: The wide slice serve is a CRITICAL tool to have in your tool box. It pulls opponents out of position, opens the court up for you to hit into, exposes their usually weaker backhand side, and forces them to run twice as far for the next shot - if they even get it at all. Let’s take a deep dive into how YOU can develop this powerful weapon, step by step in this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: 3 Djokovic Secrets To Winning More Matches - Essential Tennis Podcast #414
description: In this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast, you're going to learn the top 3 tactical secrets of Novak Djokovic that you can apply in your very next match. Use these tools to gain precision, consistency, and offense to make your opponents more uncomfortable, win more points, and win more matches.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: What is the Doha tennis schedule?
description: Novak Djokovic's first singles match since the Australian Open headlines Tuesday's order of play at the Qatar ExxonMobil Open. There are plenty of exciting Lexus ATP Head2Head matchups to watch in Doha, where second seed Alex de Minaur and fifth seed Andrey Rublev will also be in action. View the full Tuesday schedule below. ORDER OF PLAY - TUESDAY, 18 FEBRUARY 2025 Center Court - start 2:30 p.m. Roman Safiullin vs [2] Alex de Minaur (AUS) Karen Khachanov vs [4] Daniil Medvedev Not Before 5:30 p.m. [3] Novak Djokovic (SRB) vs Matteo Berrettini (ITA) [6] Stefanos Tsitsipas (GRE) vs [SE] Hamad Medjedovic (SRB) Grandstand 1 - start 2:30 p.m. [Q] Botic van de Zandschulp (NED) vs [WC] Abdullah Shelbayh (JOR) Not Before 4 p.m. [5] Andrey Rublev vs Alexander Bublik (KAZ) [Q] Quentin Halys (FRA) vs Felix Auger-Aliassime (CAN) Julian Cash (GBR) / Lloyd Glasspool (GBR) vs [Q] Petr Nouza (CZE) / Patrik Rikl (CZE) Grandstand 2 - start 2:30 p.m. Zhizhen Zhang (CHN) vs [Q] Luca Nardi (ITA) Zizou Bergs (BEL) vs Roberto Bautista Agut (ESP) Matthew Ebden (AUS) / Joran Vliegen (BEL) vs Joe Salisbury (GBR) / Neal Skupski (GBR) Nikola Mektic (CRO) / Michael Venus (NZL) vs [3] Kevin Krawietz (GER) / Tim Puetz (GER) Grandstand 3 - start 2:30 p.m. [LL] Otto Virtanen (FIN) vs Nuno Borges (POR) Jan-Lennard Struff (GER) vs Tallon Griekspoor (NED) Followed By After suitable rest - [4] Simone Bolelli (ITA) / Andrea Vavassori (ITA) vs Rohan Bopanna (IND) / Nuno Borges (POR) [1] Marcelo Arevalo (ESA) / Mate Pavic (CRO) vs Jamie Murray (GBR) / John Peers (AUS) [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: What is the Rio tennis schedule?
description: The 2025 Rio Open presented by Claro continues Tuesday with four courts in action at the Brazilian ATP 500. Among the stars in action will be top seed Alexander Zverev and #NextGenATP Brazilian Joao Fonseca, who won his first ATP Tour title on Sunday in Buenos Aires. View the full Rio de Janeiro Tuesday order of play below. ORDER OF PLAY - TUESDAY, 18 FEBRUARY 2025 Quadra Guga Kuerten - start 16:30 [5] Sebastian Baez (ARG) vs Sumit Nagal (IND) Not Before 19:00 [1] Alexander Zverev (GER) vs Yunchaokete Bu (CHN) [SE] Joao Fonseca (BRA) vs Alexandre Muller (FRA) Quadra 1 - start 16:30 Corentin Moutet (FRA) vs [8] Tomas Martin Etcheverry (ARG) [4] Francisco Cerundolo (ARG) vs Hugo Gaston (FRA) [WC] Orlando Luz (BRA) / Felipe Meligeni Alves (BRA) vs [2] Ariel Behar (URU) / Robert Galloway (USA) Nicolas Barrientos (COL) / Gregoire Jacq (FRA) vs [WC] Marcelo Demoliner (BRA) / Fernando Romboli (BRA) Quadra 2 - start 16:30 Dusan Lajovic (SRB) vs Damir Dzumhur (BIH) Mariano Navone (ARG) vs Roberto Carballes Baena (ESP) [7] Pedro Martinez (ESP) vs [LL] Camilo Ugo Carabelli (ARG) Quadra 4 - start 16:30 Luciano Darderi (ITA) vs [Q] Hugo Dellien (BOL) [Q] Tomas Barrios Vera (CHI) vs [LL] Jaime Faria (POR) Alexander Erler (AUT) / Constantin Frantzen (GER) vs [Q] Francisco Cabral (POR) / Jean-Julien Rojer (NED) Followed By After suitable rest - Luciano Darderi (ITA) / Mariano Navone (ARG) vs Francisco Cerundolo (ARG) / Tomas Martin Etcheverry (ARG) [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: 'Like a Premier League footballer being banned in summer' - Broady on Sinner ruling
description: Liam Broady believes Jannik Sinner's three-month doping ban has been timed to impact the world number one's career "as little as possible".

title: Draper and Alcaraz through to last 16 at Qatar Open
description: Jack Draper produces a dominant performance to defeat Alexei Popyrin and reach the second round of the Qatar Open.

title: Sinner Dominates in One Sided Australian Open Final
description: Jannik Sinner successfully defended his Australian Open title on Sunday, landing his third Grand Slam commandingly with a 6-3, 7-6(4), 6-3 victory over Alexander Zverev. Sinner was ruthless from the baseline and did not face a single break point throughout the two-hour, 42-minute final. The Italian showed his extra firepower from the outset, which has …
author: Jonathan

title: Australian Open 2025 Day 13 Semi Final Recap
description: Jannik Sinner and Alexander Zverev will face off in Sunday’s 2025 Australian Open final after winning their semi-finals on Friday. Alexander Zverev was the first to move into Sunday’s showpiece, defeating Novak Djokovic when the Serb retired after losing the first set on a tiebreak. Novak had not hit a tennis ball since his win …
author: Jonathan
